articles.author: Jacinta Bowler
articles.title: NASA Has Translated a Hubble Photo Into Music, And It's Absolutely Chilling - ScienceAlert
articles.description: The Universe is a wondrous place, full of vast numbers of planets to explore, unsolved mysteries, and even 'superbubbles' blown by black holes.
articles.content:
The Universe is a wondrous place, full of vast numbers of planets to explore, unsolved mysteries, and even 'superbubbles' blown by black holes.
But there's one thing that space really isn't: loud. Without Earth's air molecules to help you hear, out there in … [+2099 chars]

articles.author: Tom Cotterill
articles.title: There's a meteor shower this weekend and here's how and when you can see it if in Portsmouth - Portsmouth News
articles.description: A STUNNING meteor shower will fill the sky above Britain this weekend.
articles.content:
Eta Aquariids, the annual meteor shower in May, will be visible from this evening across the Portsmouth area.
Weather permitting, the cosmic display could produce up to 40 shooting stars an hour at its peak.
Although the peak of the shower is expected to fa… [+2040 chars]

articles.author: Ciaran McGrath
articles.title: Space travel breakthrough: Solar sail offers route to stars at one fifth of light speed - Express.co.uk
articles.description: TRIALS of a pioneering solar sail will mark the latest phase of a process which will see human beings become a space-faring species, astrophysicist Avi Loeb, one of the scientists masterminding the Breakthrough Starshot project has said.

articles.description: If all goes to plan, later this month two American astronauts, Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken, will sit in a tiny capsule perched on top of a rocket, waiting as the seconds count down before blasting
articles.content: If all goes to plan, later this month two American astronauts, Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken, will sit in a tiny capsule perched on top of a rocket, waiting as the seconds count down before blasting into the sky above Florida. It will be a symbolic moment: the … [+438 chars]

articles.title: Moroccan Shows Dinosaur ‘Like No Other’ Could Swim Using Tail - Morocco World News
articles.description: German-Moroccan paleontologist Nizar Ibrahim has published new evidence that spinosaurid dinosaurs could swim, using their tails to propel them in water.
articles.content: The fossil tail suggests the Spinosaurus aegyptiacus could swim, a departure from the commonly-held belief non-avian dinosaurs could not swim.Rabat – German-Moroccan paleontologist Nizar Ibrahim has published new evidence that spinosaurid dinosaurs could swim… [+2119 chars]

articles.author: Jason Goodyer
articles.title: Entire surface of the Moon mapped for the first time - sciencefocus.com
articles.description: Decades-long project completed using data from six Apollo-era regional maps along with updated information from recent satellite missions to the Moon.
articles.content: These colourful maps showing the craggy surface of the Moon in exhaustive detail were put together following a mammoth effort by researchers from the US Geological Survey, NASA, and the Lunar Planetary Institute. It is the first time the entire lunar surface … [+2535 chars]

articles.title: UBC researchers establish new timeline for ancient magnetic field on Mars - HeritageDaily
articles.description: Mars had a global magnetic field much earlier-and much later-in the planet's history than scientists have previously known. - Space & Planetary HeritageDaily - Archaeology News

Mars had a global magnetic field much earlier–and much later–in the planet’s history than scientists have previously known.
